Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies, and similar features.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Applies only to features that are not roofed.

Variables.has_roof: boolean (must be false for this rule to apply)

Conditions.conditional_logic: IF has_roof IS false THEN GFA contribution is 0.

Exceptions.ambiguous_language: The text states features 'generally do not count', which implies there may be unstated exceptions. The exact conditions are not fully defined.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 1 of 6 for assessing GFA of porch/entryway features.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: This rule is the baseline for features without a roof, contrasting with rules 2 through 6 which all pertain to roofed features.

extracted_rules.rule: GFA Calculation for Roofed Porches on 1st Floor

Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to roofed porches located on the 1st floor.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Entry features, features on upper floors, non-roofed features, recessed porches.

Variables.height: dimensional (value does not affect the condition for counting)

Conditions.mandatory: Feature must be a roofed porch on the 1st floor.
Conditions.dependencies: 'Openness of the sides determines whether or not these count'. The specific criteria for 'openness' are not defined on this page.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF (feature counts based on openness criteria) THEN GFA contribution is area * 1.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: The rule applies 'regardless of the height'.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 2 of 6 for assessing GFA of porch/entryway features.
Relationships.cross_references: Figure 4 (A & D) on p. 7; Figure 5 on p. 8; Code Sections: 18.04.030(a)(65), 18.04.030(q)([illegible]), 18.04.030([illegible]), 18.12.040(b)Table 3.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: The definition of 'porch' vs 'entry feature' (from right-side callout box) is critical for applying this rule. The footer note indicates more details are on subsequent pages.

extracted_rules.rule: GFA Calculation for Low-Height Roofed Entry Features on 1st Floor

Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12 feet high from grade.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Porches, features more than or equal to 12 feet high, features on upper floors.

Conditions.mandatory: Feature must be a roofed entry feature on the 1st floor.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF height_from_grade < 12' THEN GFA contribution is area * 1.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: The feature counts 'regardless of the design including openess'.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 3 of 6 for assessing GFA. It is a sub-case of 'Roofed entry features on the 1st floor', contrasting with Rule 4.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Mutually exclusive with Rule 4 based on the height variable. Depends on the definition of 'entry feature' vs 'porch'.

extracted_rules.rule: GFA Calculation for High-Height (Vaulted) Roofed Entry Features on 1st Floor

Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12 feet high from grade. These are termed 'vaulted entry feature'.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Porches, features less than or equal to 12 feet high, features on upper floors.

Conditions.mandatory: Feature must be a roofed entry feature on the 1st floor.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF height_from_grade > 12' THEN GFA contribution is area * 2.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: The feature counts 'regardless of the design including openess'.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 4 of 6 for assessing GFA. It is a sub-case of 'Roofed entry features on the 1st floor', contrasting with Rule 3.
Relationships.cross_references: Figure 4 (C & D) on p. 7; Figures 6, 7, & 8 on pp. 11-13; Code Sections: 18.04.030(a)(65), 18.04.030(q)([illegible]), 18.04.030([illegible]), 18.12.040(b)Table 3.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Mutually exclusive with Rule 3 based on the height variable. Depends on the definition of 'entry feature' vs 'porch'.

extracted_rules.rule: GFA Calculation for Recessed Porches on 1st Floor

Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to recessed porches on the 1st floor.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Non-recessed porches, entry features, features on upper floors.

Conditions.mandatory: Feature must be a recessed porch on the 1st floor.
Conditions.dependencies: 'Height, depth, & openess determine whether or not these count'. The specific criteria for this initial determination are not defined on this page.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF (feature counts) AND (height < 17') THEN GFA contribution is area * 1. IF (feature counts) AND (height > 17') THEN GFA contribution is area * 2.

Exceptions.ambiguous_language: The conditions under which a recessed porch 'counts' based on height, depth, and openness are not specified. The footer note suggests details are on following pages, making this rule incomplete on its own.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 5 of 6 for assessing GFA of porch/entryway features.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Calculation is a two-step process: first determine if it counts at all (based on undefined criteria), then apply the multiplier based on height.

extracted_rules.rule: GFA Calculation for Roofed Balconies/Outdoor Areas on Upper Floors

Qualifiers.Scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to roofed balconies or other roofed outdoor areas on upper floors (i.e., floor level > 1).
Qualifiers.Exclusions: All features on the 1st floor, non-roofed features.

Conditions.mandatory: Feature must be a roofed balcony or outdoor area on an upper floor. GFA contribution is area * 1.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: The feature counts 'regardless of the design including openess'.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is Category 6 of 6 for assessing GFA of porch/entryway features.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: This rule is specific to upper floors, distinguishing it from rules 2-5 which are for the 1st floor.
